dashboard.title: AMRnet Dashboard
dashboard.description: This is the main dashboard page of AMRnet. Here you can view and manage various aspects of the system.

plotOptions.title: Plotting options
plotOptions.percentageTooltip: Percentage frequency data is shown only for countries with N≥20 genomes except 'No. Samples'
plotOptions.chooseDrugsTooltip: Choose one or more drug categories to see their prevalence. Selecting multiple categories shows only their shared prevalence
plotOptions.nonResTooltip: If the total {{label}} are too many, only the first 20 options are shown at a time

XDR.styphi: XDR, extensively drug resistant (MDR plus resistant to ciprofloxacin and ceftriaxone)
XDR.ngono: XDR, extensively drug resistant (resistant to two of Azithromycin, Ceftriaxone, Cefixime [category I drugs], AND resistant to Benzylpenicillin, Ciprofloxacin and Spectinomycin [category II drugs])

MDR.styphi: MDR, multidrug resistant (resistant to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, and trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole)
MDR.ngono: MDR, multidrug resistant (resistant to one of Azithromycin, Ceftriaxone, Cefixime [category I drugs], plus two or more of Benzylpenicillin, Ciprofloxacin, Spectinomycin [category II drugs])

info.decoli: Lineages are labelled as Pathovar (ST) and 7-locus MLST
info.kpneumo: Sequence type are labelled as 7-locus MLST
info.shige: Lineages are labelled as Species + HC400 cluster
info.sentericaints: Lineages are labelled as 7-locus MLST and HC150(305,1547,48,9882,728,12675,2452) cluster

about.title: About
about.subtitle: Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance Network
about.paragraph1: The AMRnet dashboard aims to make high-quality, robust and reliable genome-derived AMR surveillance data accessible to a wide audience. Visualisations are geared towards showing national annual AMR prevalence estimates and trends over time, which can be broken down and explored in terms of underlying genotypes and resistance mechanisms. We do not generate sequence data, but we hope that by making publicly deposited data more accessible and useful, we can encourage and motivate more sequencing and data sharing.

paragraph2.intro: We started with Salmonella Typhi and built on our
paragraph2.middle1: dashboard which uses data that have been curated by the
paragraph2.middle2: (to improve data quality and identify which datasets are suitable for inclusion) and analysed in
paragraph2.middle3: (to call AMR determinants and lineages from sequence data). Additional organisms have been added, using data sourced from
paragraph2.end: , however these dashboards are in beta mode as data curation is still ongoing. More organisms will be added throughout 2025.

paragraph3.text: A major barrier to using public data for surveillance is the need for careful data curation in order to identify which datasets are relevant for inclusion in pooled estimates of AMR and genotype prevalence. This kind of curation can benefit a wide range of users and we plan to work with additional organism-specific communities to curate data, and to contribute to wider efforts around metadata standards. Please get in touch if you would like to work with us (

paragraph4.text: Find out more about the project team (based at London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine), and our policy advisory group,

paragraph5.intro: The dashboard code is open access and available in
paragraph5.middle3: to access the data. Issues and feature requests can be posted

citation.title: Citation for AMRnet
citation.intro: If you use the AMRnet website or code, please cite Cerdeira LT, Dyson ZA, Sharma V, et al. AMRnet: a data visualization platform to interactively explore pathogen variants and antimicrobial resistance. Nucleic Acids Res. Published online November 6, 2025.

about.funding: The project is funded by the Wellcome Trust (grant 226432/Z/22/Z).

formValidation.invalidEmail: Please enter a valid email address.

notifications.error: An error occurred. Please try again.

note.styphi: Typhi data are curated by the <0>Global Typhoid Genomics Consortium</0> and analysed using <1>Pathogenwatch</1>.
note.ngono: <0>N. gonorrhoeae</0> data represent national and regional surveillance projects, sourced from <1>Pathogenwatch</1>.
note.kpneumo: This data is pulled from <0>Pathogenwatch</0> and represents unfiltered data deposited in NCBI/ENA. It includes diverse sources of bacteria (not just human clinical infections) and is biased towards sequencing of resistant strains. In future updates this will be mitigated using metadata curated by the <1>KlebNET Epidemiology Consortium</1>.
note.default: This data is pulled from <0>Enterobase</0> and represents unfiltered data deposited in Enterobase/NCBI/ENA, therefore may reflect a bias towards sequencing of resistant strains and/or outbreaks. This will change in future updates.

continentGraphs.plottedYears: Data are plotted for years with N ≥ 10 genomes
continentGraphs.restrictedData: Data are restricted to the Global filters selected (Year {{start}} - {{end}}) {{dataset}}, and regions/countries with N≥20 passing these filters.
